alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Hughes; Lyman; Sully (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 13 at 10:51PM MST until January 15 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Sully, Hughes, Lyman and Buffalo Counties. * WHEN...Until noon CST Monday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. Lake effect cloud streamers will continue to move off of Lake Oahe near Pierre during these early morning hours, producing a small swath of light snow and blowing snow. With wind speeds continuing to diminish, blowing snow will continue to decrease as well.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
